H0.text: Who, on his 72nd birthday in 1951, was not persuaded by UPI photographer Arthur Sassehim to smile, but stuck out his tongue instead. Charlie Chaplin

H1.text: Who, on his 72nd birthday in 1951, was not persuaded by UPI photographer Arthur Sassehim to smile, but stuck out his tongue instead. Winston Churchill

H2.text: Who, on his 72nd birthday in 1951, was not persuaded by UPI photographer Arthur Sassehim to smile, but stuck out his tongue instead. Groucho Marx

H3.text: Who, on his 72nd birthday in 1951, was not persuaded by UPI photographer Arthur Sassehim to smile, but stuck out his tongue instead. Einstien

A4.text: The photo of Einstein sticking his tongue out was taken on March 14, 1951, after Einstein's 72nd birthday celebration at The Princeton Club.

A5.text: Einstein himself requested nine prints for his personal use.
